p: Each tested EO significantly reduced the number of eggs laid upon treated as compared to control plants (cinnamon: F 1,36 = 26.39, p < 0.001; eucalyptus: F 1,36 = 16.71, p < 0.001; lavender: F 1,26 = 7.64, p < 0.05). Time had no effect on the repellency; EOs performed with equivalent efficiency throughout the five days of the trials.
